Equipment failure: Malfunctioning tools or equipment can slow down the dig and result in the loss of valuable time and resources.
Lack of funding: Insufficient financial support can limit the scale and scope of the dig, as well as the quality of the equipment and expertise available.
Permits and regulations: Obtaining the necessary permits and adhering to local and international regulations can be a complex and time-consuming process, potentially delaying the dig.
Security: Ensuring the safety of the site and the team is paramount, including measures against theft, vandalism, and unauthorized access.
Health and safety: Exposure to hazardous materials, such as chemicals or pathogens, can pose risks to the health and well-being of the team.
